newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Samsung to privately place convertibles.
newsitem.headline: Samsung to privately place convertibles.

text.p: South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co said on Monday it would privately place 60 billion won worth of convertible bonds to raise operating funds.

Samsung Electronics, flagship of Samsung Group, said in a statement its affiliate Samsung Corp had agreed to underwrite 15 billion won worth of bonds and Lee Jae-yong, Samsung Group Chairman Lee Kun-hee's son, the remainder.
The bonds, carrying a coupon of seven percent and maturing on March 24, 2002, will produce an annual yield of nine percent, the statement said.
The bonds can be converted to Samsung Electronics common shares six months after the issuing date until March 23, 2002, it said.
Conversion price was set at 50,000 won per share. Samsung Electronics closed at 56,700 won on Monday.
